conclusion: Summarize problem setup and goal to find power dissipated in resistor R.
Image shows two parallel metal rails, conductor rod MN, magnetic field B, and resistor R.
Identify forces: magnetic force F, frictional force μmg, and resistance force r.
Calculate magnetic force F as F = Bvl.
Set equilibrium condition: Bvl = μmg + rv and solve for v.
Determine power dissipation as P = I^2R = (μmg/(Bl - r))^2R.
Plug in values to calculate power dissipated: P = 12.25 W.
Conclude power dissipated in resistor is 12.25 W.
